channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024050407
item.description:
Report E-2024050407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T18:14:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: GOLIAD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1214000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 183 in Goliad, Texas when it drifted off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 5649 gallons of gasoline was released. Clean Harbors responded to the scene and continues to remediate the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024050323
item.description:
Report E-2024050323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: DURANGO
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG MERCHANT GAS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 217500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Merchant Gas Group, LLC unit was traveling eastbound on Highway 160 near Durango, Colorado when it drifted off the roadway and rolled over. The trailer was compromised as a result of the rollover and approximately 35,740 pounds of refrigerated natural gas was released into the atmosphere. The local hazmat agency handled the remediation.
